text: Fielding Legions of skeleton infantry, archers and chariots, in combination with monstrous animated constructs, the Tomb Kings overwhelm the foe with resilience and numbers. The Realm of Souls means that as more friendly units are destroyed, the Tomb Kings gain army-wide heals and eventually a powerful Ushabti summoned through the Realm of Souls system.

Focusing on hordes of gunpowder-armed zombie pirates, the forces of the Vampire Coast specialize in blocking their enemy with powerful monsters so they can blast them off the field with missile and artillery units. Led by powerful Vampire Lords with their own custom ‘Lore of the Deep’ spells.

Dark Elf armies are well-rounded, able to field armour-piercing missile units, line-breaking heavy cavalry, and elite infantry. As the Dark Elves kill more enemies, they will trigger Murderous Prowess – gaining powerful bonuses.

The armies of the High Elves field the most powerful Dragons and some of the most powerful magic-users. In addition, the rest of their roster is well rounded and of high quality. These elite units benefit from the Martial Prowess ability, providing bonuses to units which are at high strength.

Lizardmen hosts consist of strong melee units, some of the most powerful magic-users, and towering reptilian monsters. Their missile units are generally short-ranged and struggle versus armoured targets.
Endless waves of expendable infantry, supported by terror-causing monsters and hard-hitting war machines. Though generally fast moving, the Skaven do lack airborne and cavalry units.

Chaos Dwarf armies are highly flexible and wear many hats. A heavily-armoured, fire-resistant frontline is bolstered by a cheap caste of Labourers and Hobgoblin lackeys that serve as a bulwark for powerful gunpowder weaponry and long-range artillery trains. This flexibility is further augmented by powerful bound fire Daemons, flying monsters and even cavalry. All of this flexibility comes at a cost though, making the right combination of units the key to victory.

Khorne is a melee-focused race that excels at charging. They have no spellcasters, but Khornate Daemons are resistant to spells. Killing the enemy grants the Blood God’s favour, which can be used on the following army abilities:

Kislevite forces offer hardy hybrid infantry, swift cavalry and mighty War Bears; perfect for hammer and anvil tactics. Its units have the ability to find new courage when others would break, allowing the units to stand their ground against desperate odds.

Tzeentch is a race that excels at spellcasting, missile firepower and flying units. Its units are protected by a magical barrier that absorbs damage and is replenished when not taking damage. Casting spells generates favour from Tzeentch that can be used on the following army abilities:

Cathay offers solid melee units and powerful missile units, which become stronger through harmony when placed near each other. Characters increase the effect of this harmony. Additionally, their spellcasters can support each other during spellcasting, increasing the power of their spells when fielding multiple Wizards.

Daemons of Chaos allow you to mix the forces of all the Chaos Gods. This makes the race versatile and unpredictable. Causing damage with your Lord generates glory, which rewards you with random army abilities in battles from the Reign of Chaos.

Khorne is a melee-focused race that excels at charging. It has no spellcasters, but Khornate Daemons are resistant to spells. Killing the enemy grants the Blood God’s favour, which can be used on the following army abilities:

Kislevite forces offer hardy hybrid infantry, swift cavalry and mighty War Bears; perfect for hammer and anvil tactics. Its units have the ability to find new courage when others would break, allowing the units to stand their ground against desperate odds.

Nurgle is a tough and slow melee race that excels at winning battles of attrition. Its units possess great health and reduce enemy melee damage through their passive abilities. Taking damage generates favour from Nurgle, which can be used to activate the following army abilities:

The Ogre Kingdoms offer a wide variety of monstrous units with bone-crushing charges and surprising mobility. Their infantry options are limited to weak and expendable Gnoblars. Captured enemies can be slaughtered to use the following abilities:

Slaaneshi armies are very fast, excelling at flanking and piercing armour, but this comes at the cost of armour and health. Killing routing enemies grants favour from Slaanesh, which can be used to activate the following army abilities:

Tzeentch is a race that excels at spellcasting, missile firepower and flying units. Its units are protected by a magical barrier that absorbs damage and is replenished when not taking damage. Casting spells generates favour from Tzeentch that can be used on the following army abilities:

The light infantry and monster units of the Beastmen are masters of charging from ambush – able to close the gap quickly and overwhelm the enemy. However, with mediocre leadership and poor armour, Beastmen suffer in prolonged engagements, their Primal Fury ability only granting them bonuses when leadership is high.

The Woods Elves are an elite force of skirmishing archers, supported by specialist melee infantry units, fast-moving cavalry and stubborn Treemen. Though they field some of the finest archers, they are fragile, making engagements in melee costly.

Norsca is a faction of aggressive infantry, flexible monstrous infantry and colossal line-breaking Mammoths. Though lightly-armoured and vulnerable to missile fire, Norca has the tools to breach enemy lines and/or envelop the foe. The frenzied warriors of Norsca also have the Rage ability, meaning the longer they fight in melee the greater the bonuses they receive.

Bretonnia specialises in riding down their foes with powerful heavy cavalry. Supported by copious amounts of expendable peasant infantry and archers, these units buy time and space for the mounted Knights to charge, fall back and charge once more.

The Warriors of Chaos field rank upon rank of elite infantry, clad head to toe in plate armour. Pinning the foe in melee, they can then deliver brutal charges with their heavy cavalry and monstrous units.

The Dwarfs rely on steadfast, heavily-armoured infantry supported by powerful artillery and missile units. Completely lacking in cavalry, their only mobile units are the harassing Gyrocopter war machines. Though lacking access to spells, the Dwarfs are innately resistant to spell damage.

The Empire has access to a wide variety of units and employs this flexibility to out-fight their enemies on the field. Having somewhat mediocre unit quality, the Empire relies upon a combined-arms approach to win.

Greenskins field a roster of aggressive infantry, hard-hitting boar cavalry, and terror causing-monsters such as Arachnarok Spiders and Giants. Greenskins units engaged in melee generate points towards an almighty Waaagh!, a powerful, army-wide ability.

Powerful with spells and in melee, the Vampires are the core of this army and lead the legions of Undead skeletons and zombies, terrifying monsters and elite Vampiric cavalry. Completely lacking missile units, the Vampire Counts do, however, have access to powerful healing and summoning abilities to replace losses.
